metadata.feature_description: Analytics for wiki content including page edits, contributors, and content growth

steps.actual: Login successful, PersonaBar visible with Dashboard, Content, Manage, etc. options

steps.expected: Dashboard panel opens with Site Analytics view
steps.actual: Dashboard opens showing Site Analytics with Google Analytics warning dialog

steps.action: Hover over Dashboard to see submenu and select Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics panel opens with Overall Dashboard view and module tabs
steps.actual: Community Analytics panel fails to load - shows blank/empty panel. JavaScript error in console: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function at dashboardClass.init

steps.expected: Community Analytics should display analytics data with module tabs (including Wiki)
steps.actual: Community Analytics panel remains blank. Console shows critical error in social-dashboard-combined-instance.js:1025 - the utility.serializeCustomDate function is undefined

issues: Critical JavaScript error prevents Community Analytics from loading: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function
The utility module appears to be missing the serializeCustomDate function that Community Analytics depends on
This blocks access to ALL Community Analytics features including Wiki Module Analytics

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics > Wiki Tab
steps.expected: Wiki analytics tab displays with page statistics
steps.actual: Cannot access - Community Analytics module fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test - Community Analytics module fails to initialize

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics > Wiki Tab and view edit frequency metrics
steps.expected: Edit frequency data displayed showing wiki edit patterns over time
steps.actual: Cannot access - Community Analytics module fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test - Community Analytics module fails to initialize

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics > Wiki Tab and view contributor metrics
steps.expected: Contributor activity data displayed showing who edited wiki pages
steps.actual: Cannot access - Community Analytics module fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test - Community Analytics module fails to initialize

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics > Wiki Tab and view popular pages list
steps.expected: Popular wiki pages displayed ranked by views/engagement
steps.actual: Cannot access - Community Analytics module fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test - Community Analytics module fails to initialize

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics > Wiki Tab and verify wiki-specific metrics are displayed
steps.expected: Wiki-specific metrics (page views, edits, contributors) displayed correctly
steps.actual: Cannot access - Community Analytics module fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test - Community Analytics module fails to initialize

steps.action: Navigate to Community Analytics > Wiki Tab and view content growth charts
steps.expected: Content growth analytics displayed showing wiki growth trends over selected time period
steps.actual: Cannot access - Community Analytics module fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test - Community Analytics module fails to initialize

observations: Community Analytics module menu item exists under Dashboard submenu and is accessible
Clicking Community Analytics triggers a critical JavaScript error that prevents the entire module from loading
The error 'TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function' indicates a missing dependency or API mismatch
The error originates in social-dashboard-combined-instance.js:1025 during dashboardClass.init()
This appears to be a regression or configuration issue - the utility module does not expose the serializeCustomDate function
Site Analytics (also under Dashboard) shows similar initialization patterns but with different errors (Google Analytics not configured)
No Wiki Tab or any Community Analytics features could be accessed due to this blocking error
Code review shows the API controllers exist (CommunityAnalyticsController.cs) with endpoints for GetModuleDashboardInfo, GetModuleTagStats, GetModulePopularContent - but the UI cannot reach them
